Acid.description: A foul-smelling liquid that scalds flesh, but is easily stopped by armor.

Ambrosia.description: A cup of the milky nectar of the gods that replenishes both body and mind.

Amulet.description: A chunk of a strange stone that fell from between the stars, now worn as a necklace to grant magical power and sometimes resilience against Atomic attacks.

Angelic.description: Those who can take the form of Celestials grow shining wings that can buffet enemies.

Armor Seed.description: A small green seed that grows into flexible armor made of vines when watered.

Armor Spikes.description: A series of heavily spiked straps meant to fit over armor, these defenses make fighting you in melee a challenge.

Beer.description: A favorite of those who don't want to stop drinking.

Black Belt.description: A martial artist's best friend, the Black Belt is a common reward from a dojo to a long-time student.

Black Spot.description: A pirate's foul mouth is nothing compared to the curse they can emit with a Black Spot.

Blast Powder.description: For one shot, it's an incredible improvement over the black powder firearms typically use.

Bomb Set.description: A satchel filled with primitive grenades, each a simple clay pot filled with black powder.

Bow.description: An old variety of ranged weapon that has seen considerable improvement to compete with firearms.

Bread.description: Wholesome, pure, and very filling, Bread is the simplest way to ease an aching belly.

Broadsword.description: A wide-bladed two-handed sword that mixes the savagery of an axe with the precision of a sword.

Cake.description: A baked delight decorated with sugary icing; it isn't as filling as you'd hope.

Candy.description: Once you start eating Candy, you don't want to stop eating Candy.

Cannon.description: A very-long-ranged weapon that can obliterate one enemy with fire, though it takes ages to load.

Cape.description: Among the least effective ways to kill someone, but great for confusing foes and deflecting projectiles.

Carving Knife.description: This sharpened chef's implement is just as good at slicing up a steak as it is slashing living flesh.

Chakram Set.description: A collection of bladed hoops, meant to be worn along the forearms for blocking or hurled quickly at foes.

Cheese.description: A fairly nutritious food that makes you briefly more robust, but rots quickly.

Cloak.description: An overcloak that helps protect against ailments and magic, and sometimes is waterproof enough to guard against Water attacks.

Cold Snap.description: A frigid piece of blue alchemical crystal that instantly chills its surroundings when broken.

Crossbow.description: Part-way between the Bow and the Musket, Crossbows are highly accurate and easily pierce armor.

Crown.description: A royal headpiece that ensures the wearer won't be belittled; the best Crowns protect against Holy attacks, the result of mistrust between churches and kings.

Crystal.description: A potent meditation aid that allows its holder to ignore hunger and may scatter Light attacks.

Dagger Set.description: A versatile choice, the Dagger Set is typically concealed between layers of clothing for surprise stabs.

Derringer Set.description: Carrying many small loaded firearms lets you avoid loading a gun in combat, though the range isn't great.

Dispel Gel.description: A cube of gray jelly in a paper wrapper that absorbs magic power when the wrapper breaks.

Egg.description: Eating a raw Egg is a great way to feel strong, but eating too many makes you ill instead.

Elegant Garb.description: A dress or toga so beautiful that anyone charming you can't concentrate; it may flow and divert Wind attacks.

Encyclopedia.description: Just carrying an Encyclopedia helps you feel confident in your mental faculties and may shield against subtle Void attacks.

Fish.description: Even a small fish is powerfully nutritious and helps sharpen your reflexes.

Flail.description: A nasty spiked ball whipped around on a heavy chain; it's simply brutal against armored foes.

Forbidden Scroll.description: Illegal, but still sometimes used by mages as a last resort to avoid other mages' spells.

Fossil Fang.description: A gift of the land to those who protect it, this massive tooth carries primal magic power.

Fruit.description: A small sweet fruit that is nicely invigorating; commonly found by foraging.

Fury Froth.description: A roiling foam held in a sealed lead flask; when opened it lashes out at everything nearby.

Greataxe.description: It's hard to beat this two-handed axe when it comes to overkill; the destruction these wreak is legendary.

Grimoire.description: A Black Book, with a Shadow attack that turns magic defense against the target but is otherwise weak.

Hammer.description: A heavy one-handed tool converted into a weapon of war that is especially strong against armor.

Handaxe Set.description: Some call them tomahawks, others hunga munga; this is a bag of throwing axes by any name.

Hat.description: A headpiece that carries minor protective spells; some are built to divert Sound attacks from the wearer's head.

Hatchet.description: A medium-sized axe balanced for carving wood rather than throwing, it can carve flesh just as well.

Heavy Armor.description: Though it is one of the strongest protections available against physical attack, Heavy Armor is exhausting to wear.

Honey.description: A chunk of honeycomb laden with sweet, sticky goodness; sometimes found by foraging.

Instrument.description: A fine musical instrument designed to play clear notes for casting spells, with a simple Sound attack.

Javelin Set.description: A back-carried container of short spear-like weapons balanced more for throwing than thrusting.

Katana.description: A curved blade attributed mystical power that can make effortless quick slices with impressive accuracy.

Lance.description: An uncommon weapon, the Lance can't attack a close-by enemy but can annihilate further-away foes.

Light Armor.description: Light Armor helps protect its wearer from physical attack, and may also protect against magic or other forms of attack as well.

Liquor.description: Liquor gets you drunk quicker, but it can be sickeningly strong.

Longspear.description: The art of killing a man with a pointed stick has gotten more complex over time, but the weapon has not.

Longsword.description: Longswords have good accuracy, damage, and parrying ability, helping their bearer excel in every battle.

Marque.description: A letter written by an authority that gives its holder a disciplined calm, and may protect from effects related to the laws of the land.

Mask.description: A primitive wood face-covering, it serves the simple purpose of protecting the eyes and face, but may also grant protection from Fire.

Meat.description: Though not quite as strengthening as an Egg, Meat is much more filling.

Musket.description: A two-handed firearm that spits out a heavy lead ball; its damage is impressive, but its load time isn't.

Net.description: A tool used for fishing or trapping, refitted for bringing down human targets without harming them.

Nut.description: Gobbling down Nuts helps keep your body hardened to attack, while continuing to be filling.

Orb.description: A perfectly round crystal that allows its bearer to both contemplate Void and attack with Void magic.

Pistol.description: A one-handed firearm that pierces armor easily and at decent range, but is slow to reload.

Pole.description: Whether an collapsible pole or just a piece of bamboo, a Pole is excellent at whacking multiple foes.

Polearm.description: A Polearm could be a halberd, glaive, ranseur, guan do, or just about any sharp thing on a long stick.

Prayer Bead.description: A tiny, rune-inscribed stone; when the rune is read aloud, it erupts in deific power.

Pure Water.description: A glass vessel filled with water so clear it might be divine; can cleanse evil from objects.

Quiver.description: A container filled with arrows or bolts meant for Bows or Crossbows, having a better Quiver means you are better at archery.

Razor Deck.description: An fine deck of cards with razor-sharp wire running around each card's edge; a tricky thrown weapon.

Relic.description: A preserved piece of an object involved in a miracle long ago, a Relic protects against curses and may even work against deadly Wasting attacks.

Robe.description: Though this appears to be an overly-decorated bathrobe, it is known to magicians as a potent reflector of their spells.

Rotten Food.description: A putrid lump of unidentifiable garbage that can defile whatever it is smeared on.

Rumble Stone.description: A fist-sized rock painted to depict a scene of disaster; when thrown, the earth trembles.

Saber.description: An elegant dueling weapon that is sharp all along its blade; ideal for thrusting attacks and parries.

Safety Rune.description: A scroll containing a calligraphic word; when dropped to the ground it shields those nearby.

Sandals.description: An easy way to move more quickly that provides resistance to entangling effects, and may carry protection against Earth attacks.

Scepter.description: A magician's response to the firearm; this is a two-handed heavy staff that "fires" massive magic blasts.

Scimitar.description: A strongly curved one-handed blade meant for drawing blood from multiple foes with one sweeping slice

Serum.description: An oily fluid made mostly from monster organs; grants a drinker brief but mighty strength.

Shackle Glyph.description: An alphabetical letter made of thin iron chains that contorts to trap an enemy of the law.

Shield.description: Not esteemed as a weapon, Shields greatly support a bearer's defenses, and for that they are common.

Shortsword.description: Not quite a knife or a sword, Shortswords are heavier than they look, but can still be swung quickly.

Shuriken Set.description: Some dismiss Dagger Sets and prefer these throwing stars; they cause brutal damage to exposed skin.

Soul Smoke.description: A bottle of smoke that can replenish exhausted items, but may carry a curse if overused.

Staff.description: A Staff can sweep but otherwise is a lackluster weapon; its mirror and parry abilities make it useful.

Stealth Garb.description: A black, tightly-fitting garment that can be worn over armor and helps wriggle out of immobilization; may shield against Shadow attacks.

Sticky Flame.description: A white blob of alchemical origin, it burns fiercely when exposed to air or even water.

Suit.description: A finely tailored garment that helps your confidence; may carry enchantment against Entropy attacks.

Sun Drop.description: A pouch holding a glass vial with shining fluid inside; the light is strong enough to burn.

Symbol.description: A holy symbol, regardless of religion, can issue divine judgment even when simply worn or carried.

Tornado Fan.description: What appears to be a simple paper fan can be activated once to summon a mighty gale.

Totem.description: A small amulet made of hand-carved wood and bone that helps protect from nature's most common nuisances, sometimes including Poison attacks.

Unarmed.description: Since Unarmed attacks can be mixed into weapon attacks, many warriors pick up basic brawling skills.

Uranium Ore.description: A chunk of greenish-yellow rock with a magic spell holding its radiation in... until it's thrown.

Utility Harness.description: A cluster of cables linking a harness over your body to items you want to hold onto; good ones are designed to ground the user against Storm attacks.

Vegetable.description: Vegetables are commonly found by foraging, and are filling even if somewhat boring.

Vile.description: Those who can take the form of Fiends exude horrid tentacles that rot the flesh of their enemies.

Whip.description: The tool of a harsh taskmaster or possibly a beast tamer, Whips are strong against unarmored foes.

Wild.description: Those who can take the form of Animals gain better defenses and attacks, but can't wield weapons.

Wine.description: An elegant drink that only gets finer with age, and helps a drinker stay safe from magic.
